subject: Relationships
title: Royal Marriages: Love Was Never the Point
description: Learn Royal Marriages: Love Was Never the Point in one minute.

hook.text: Henry VIII didn't marry six times for love. He married for alliances, heirs, and power. Love was a diplomatic accident.

buildup.text: Royal marriages were treaties in human form. A princess sent abroad was a living peace agreement.

discovery.text: The Habsburgs married so strategically that one family controlled half of Europe through weddings, not wars.

twist.text: Charles and Diana married for 'love' in 1981 and it failed. Strategic pairing was brutal but effective.

climax.text: Royal marriage shows what happens when love is optional and power is mandatory. The crown always came first.

punchline.text: Royal marriages weren't love stories. They were signed treaties in human form.

quiz.question: How did the Habsburgs gain control of much of Europe?
